body: removing the WIP. this is ready to merge @chipsenkbeil or @Lull3rSkat3r
LGTM

@kapil-malik Thanks for the PR. My comments below mainly for discussion purposes.

I'm currently thinking that this type of option is more specific to Toree than to Spark. At this time, the codebase makes a distinction. Spark specific are in SparkConf, Toree specific are in a typesafe Config object. If we agree, then we need to modify the PR to read the value out of Config and then use `reference.conf` to hold the default.
LGTM (these tests really need to be fixed)
@Lull3rSkat3r  Did you intend to push the tutorial with cell output?

Also, would be nice if have a similar template for all our examples. Look at the https://github.com/apache/incubator-toree/blob/master/etc/examples/notebooks/sqlcontext_sharing.ipynb. We should have table of contents and links to navigate back to the top.
@lbustelo I can add the table of contents and links. Will add that and push.
@lbustelo changes are pushed.
@kapil-malik, any reason why you closed this?
@chipsenkbeil Can you test this and run the streaming example?

@chipsenkbeil tested the streaming demo and it ran for him. 

There is no compilation problem on the notebook with these changes.

This PR is now ready. 

To verify:
1. Run `make dev` and make sure it is on 1.6.0 (we are using all-spark-notebook and that is not yet at 1.6.1)
2. Run `make jupyter` same as 1
3. Run `make dev-binder` and see that the binder images is at 1.6.1 and examples work.

/cc @Lull3rSkat3r @chipsenkbeil

Note... the binder image pulls in toree from pypi, so it is getting `0.1.0.dev4`. That package does not have the fix to know where py4j is.

To fully test binder, we will have to publish a `0.1.0.dev5`

@lbustelo, just ran `make jupyter` and printed out the version using `sc.version` and it still says `1.5.1` instead of `1.6.0` or `1.6.1`. Did I miss something? I saw Apache 1.6.1 was being used at the beginning when things were being built/run using sbt.
LGTM
I'm adjusting the checklist above based on http://incubator.apache.org/guides/releasemanagement.html#check-list

I'll look into the following:
Uploading files for distribution: http://www.apache.org/dev/release.html#upload-scp
Signing releases: http://www.apache.org/dev/release-signing.html#basic-facts
I'm going to work on `Rename bin package to contain the name 'incubating'`
Adding item to list to `Rename referent to toree kernel in notebook to Apache Toree` based on http://incubator.apache.org/guides/branding.htm
I'm going to work on `Package Notice/Licence file in pip distro`
Based on http://incubator.apache.org/guides/releasemanagement.html#best-practice-license I'm creating an item to list the License of other bundled dependencies in our package. i.e. LGPL.

There is no magic, I guess it's a manual process, by looking into all dependencies being packaged on the distribution and create the LICENSE and NOTICE file. Some projects does it a little different, where they add the LICENSE files into a folder and either point to them or aggregate them.
It seems that spark has all of it already compiled in their top level LICENSE and NOTICE files https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/branch-1.0/LICENSE

I have compiled this list of license information for our direct and transitive dependencies. @lbustelo, you should be able to find information in most of those links for the NOTICES file.

# BSD-like

## Direct dependencies

org.clapper:classutil_2.10:1.0.3 -> http://software.clapper.org/javautil/#copyright-and-license
org.scala-lang:scala-reflect:2.10.4 -> http://www.scala-lang.org/license.html
org.scalamacros:quasiquotes_2.10:2.0.1 -> http://www.scala-lang.org/license.html

## Transitive Dependencies

jline:jline:2.6 -> https://github.com/jline/jline2/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
org.clapper:grizzled-scala_2.10:1.1.2 -> http://software.clapper.org/grizzled-scala/#copyright-and-license
org.clapper:grizzled-slf4j_2.10:1.0.1 -> http://software.clapper.org/grizzled-slf4j/#copyright-and-license
org.scala-stm:scala-stm_2.10:0.7 -> https://nbronson.github.io/scala-stm/license.html
org.scalaz:scalaz-concurrent_2.10:7.1.2  -> https://github.com/scalaz/scalaz/blob/series/7.1.x/etc/LICENCE
org.scalaz:scalaz-core_2.10:7.1.2 -> https://github.com/scalaz/scalaz/blob/series/7.1.x/etc/LICENCE
org.scalaz:scalaz-effect_2.10:7.1.2 -> https://github.com/scalaz/scalaz/blob/series/7.1.x/etc/LICENCE
asm:asm-commons:3.3 -> http://asm.ow2.org/license.html
asm:asm-tree:3.3 -> http://asm.ow2.org/license.html
asm:asm:3.3 -> http://asm.ow2.org/license.html

# MIT license

## Direct dependencies

net.sf.jopt-simple:jopt-simple:4.6 -> https://pholser.github.io/jopt-simple/license.html
org.slf4j:slf4j-api:1.7.5 -> http://www.slf4j.org/license.html
org.slf4j:slf4j-api:1.7.1 -> http://www.slf4j.org/license.html

## Transitive Dependencies

com.lihaoyi:ammonite-terminal_2.10:0.5.0 -> https://github.com/lihaoyi/Ammonite/blob/master/LICENSE

# GNU General Lesser Public License (LGPL) version 3.0

## Direct dependencies

org.zeromq:jeromq:0.3.4 -> https://github.com/zeromq/jeromq/blob/master/COPYING

a couple of links guiding NOTICE file content

http://www.apache.org/dev/licensing-howto.html#mod-notice

> Copyright notifications which have been relocated from source files (rather than removed) must be preserved in NOTICE. However, elements such as the copyright notifications embedded within BSD and MIT licenses need not be duplicated in NOTICE -- it suffices to leave those notices in their original locations.
> 
> It is important to keep NOTICE as brief and simple as possible, as each addition places a burden on downstream consumers.
> 
> Do not add anything to NOTICE which is not legally required.

http://apache.org/legal/resolved.html#required-third-party-notices

> When a release contains third party works, the licenses covering those works may ask that consumers are informed in certain specific fashions. These third party notices vary from license to license. Apache releases should contain a copy of each license, usually contained in the LICENSE document. For many licenses this is a sufficient notice. For some licenses some additional notice is required. In many cases, this will be included within the dependent artifact.
> 
> A required third-party notice is any third party notice which isn't covered by the above cases.
> 
> See Bundling Other ASF Products for a note on required notices when a release contains another Apache product.
based on https://github.com/zeromq/jeromq/blob/master/COPYING.LESSER#L91... I'm adding the license to the uber packages (pip, bin, and assembly jar)
Thread regarding single release with LGPL http://apache-incubator-general.996316.n3.nabble.com/Release-dependant-on-LGPL-td48424.html

In case we need it, here is a list of all the Apache Dependencies:

com.typesafe.play:play-functional_2.10:2.3.6
com.typesafe.play:play-iteratees_2.10:2.3.6
org.springframework:spring-core:4.1.1.RELEASE

I have a [PR](https://github.com/lbustelo/incubator-toree/pull/11) for removing the systems tests. I created a [jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-296) for adding them back with [jupyter kernel test](https://github.com/jupyter/jupyter_kernel_test).
/cc @lbustelo and @chipsenkbeil
Looks like the tests pass. The one error in one run was a timing issue (again).
tested with Jupyter 4.2 and Ipywidgets 5.0 on master and replicated the error. Then tested with the changes here and the kernel started all the way.

@chipsenkbeil  Should we wait for SparkIMain to be decoupled from class server . How can we get SparkContext and Spark Conf inside ScalaInterpreterSpecific 2.11 trait so that we can create Classserver and set its URI in spark configuration.
Seems that the default Scala version for spark 2.0 also moved to 2.11.
Resolves https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-300

@chipsenkbeil Please take a look at this. I think it should be ready for merge. We still do not have a way to automate some of this, but I think we can tackle that separately. There are quite a bit of changes here that it's better to merge now and than having to keep rebasing this PR.

@lbustelo @Lull3rSkat3r, read through it all and looks good. It looks like the system tests have been removed (along with using a consistent Akka timeout). Do we have plans in the near future to use the Jupyter kernel test project?
@chipsenkbeil There is a separate [issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-296) for that.
Cool, then LGTM. Want me to merge?
@chipsenkbeil yes... merge it
@lbustelo, rebased with master after your PR.  This should be ready for review.
looks good
@Lull3rSkat3r please rebase
@lbustelo rebased
ok... looks good. merging
Sorry @dongjoon-hyun... I just fixed this straight in master. thanks for the issue.
Should be fixed by https://github.com/apache/incubator-toree/commit/5edd6d7d1286576b5ac765d8810c70d6b0f1dbe2

This PR also remove redundant blank lines, too.
It's not identical.

Anyway, thank you for response.
By the way, could you give me some reason why you ignore my PR?
I really appreciate it, too.
I know that you didn't looked at my PR before. I'm just wondering there is some reason like policy in Apache TOREE project(incubating).

@dongjoon-hyun Sorry... I did not mean to ignore the PR. I saw your email come in about the issue and just went straight to fix. So I had committed before I saw that you already had a PR. Please feel free to rebase the PR and still submit the issues with empty spaces.
@Lull3rSkat3r Please check the results of Travis and if it looks like it did the test, RAT and clean, this should be good to merge.

It's okay. For urgent HOTFIX issue, I experienced many time like this.
I'm just wondering there is some kind of rule.
It seams that Apache TOREE (incubating) still prefer direct commits without PR and review process.
Thank you for explanation, @lbustelo .
I'm going to close and reopen the PR to force another build. This will test if the after-script is doing its job.

The rerun worked fine, I'll take it that it is cleaning up properly. There reason that I'm a bit sckeptical is that I see the caching happening before the `after_script`. So either it is caching the unlock, or this is just a problem that is needed under certain circumstances, such as a build failure.

@chipsenkbeil You remember the reason you had [this](https://github.com/apache/incubator-toree/blob/c3470855f8f7bf7a0cb03082d22fe1ef10f8da98/Makefile#L165)

@lbustelo that came from instructions in sbt regarding using Travis' caching: http://www.scala-sbt.org/0.13/docs/Travis-CI-with-sbt.html#%28Experimental%29+Reusing+Ivy+cache

It looks like the instructions have changed since I added that, though. Now using the before_cache option of Travis and removing via:

``` scala
before_cache:
  # Tricks to avoid unnecessary cache updates
  - find $HOME/.ivy2 -name "ivydata-*.properties" -delete
  - find $HOME/.sbt -name "*.lock" -delete
```
Rebased with a new commit message according to the commit code.
@chipsenkbeil Since I was able to run the PR twice, you think that the `after-script` is working?
https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/caching/#Build-phases points to the cache taking place before `after-script`. What if I unlock in `before-script`?
I think I'm going to switch the cleaning to happen on `before-cache` https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/caching/#before_cache-phase

@chipsenkbeil I think the shell commands are basically the same. I moved the target to `before-cache` and it all seemed to work.

Either @chipsenkbeil  or @Lull3rSkat3r , merge this when you get a chance.
Ping @lbustelo .
No. PRs are the preferred way for contributions. I just took a shortcut on some of my fixes today.
I'll take a look at this tomorrow.
I see. Thank you, @lbustelo .
merged
Thank you for merging, @lbustelo .
LGTM
@chipsenkbeil I've updated with your feedback.

@ericchang, sorry, but would you mind rebasing your PR? We're trying to keep our commit log clean(er). The only change in master since this PR is the merging of your other PR, so it should be pretty straight forward. Once you do that, I'll merge it in. :)

@Lull3rSkat3r, @lbustelo, if you look at the test results for this PR (https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-toree/builds/126418257), you'll notice that we still have two unstable tests in `TaskManager` and `BrokerTransformer`. Not sure what you want to do about them.
@chipsenkbeil no problem, I usually rebase just forgot that my other PR had been merged :)
Awesome, thanks!
Merged in as commit https://github.com/apache/incubator-toree/commit/cea63655a47d55334492f532c8ce1a22b5a3a457
Fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-308
I'm merging this. Thanks @poplav
Resolves https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-261
other than the comments on name of the directory... the changes look good.
@lbustelo updated the commits to reference toree and not spark_kernel (included the change to add_jar here)
cc @lbustelo
@lbustelo should be ready for review.  Ensured the tests were updated and they all pass locally.

@lbustelo, @Lull3rSkat3r, was looking at the tests. I thought you guys found and fixed whatever was causing the kernel to hang during test runs. In fact, I thought it was related to the system tests, which are gone, right? Any idea why the tests hanged this time?
@chipsenkbeil, no idea.

Ran meetup notebook and saw the folders get created for JARs and DEPS and saw content there after running cells. Also ran cells that used the JARs and the DEPS and they compile. That is good enough for me to merge this.

The only thing that I'm going to fix on a separate commit straight to master is the name of the kernel in [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-toree/pull/36/files#diff-5a58afa262c7d727edde469f8413626aR786).

@poplav We should make sure we save notebooks when running them using `make jupyter` not `make dev`. Right now the kernels are named different.
@lbustelo, rebased.
All tests passed locally and I ran the magic demo notebook. Added another commit on top of this to add the `%%DataFrame` section to the TOC of the notebook.
@poplav Please rebase this PR
@lbustelo just rebased with master
@chipsenkbeil or @Lull3rSkat3r Can one of you take care of verifying this PR and merging?
I will verify and merge this.

@lbustelo the travis issues/resolutions were (reflected in the latest commit): - when pip packaging make sure we run the containers as root (pip permission issues on writing) - I ran into the exact travis issue docuemented at [Buffer overflow in Java_java_net_Inet4AddressImpl_getLocalHostName of OpenJDK6 and OpenJDK 7](https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/5227) when introducing the docker service. The possible resolutions are: - Run tests with `oraclejdk7` instead of `openjdk7`. `openjdk7` is the one causing the issue. I think this is best. - Implement the fix in the issue which modifies the /etc/hosts file in the travis `before_install`. /etc/hosts file changes on travis are: - FYI, the build time is ~20 minutes in total now, where before it looked to be ~13 minutes.
This should be ready for review.
@poplav, it looks like this doesn't cover all the cases in [TOREE 296](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TOREE-296). Can you comment on that JIRA what is not covered by this PR?
@Lull3rSkat3r updated the JIRA.

@poplav, _sniff_, it's so beautiful to have real system tests. Brings a tear to the eye.

Also, you mentioned in the JIRA requesting that they open more APIs to be testable. Could you go ahead and do that for the Comm API at least since that's an important one?
@chipsenkbeil , Yes that is an open item on [jupyter_kernel_test](https://github.com/jupyter/jupyter_kernel_test).  I haven't looked into detail yet how that would be implemented, but will..
@poplav some more comments and then I think it should be ready to merge
